items.title: Altena oogst lof in Schotland: 'Uitstekende eerste indruk met fraaie assist'
items.summary: Jordi Altena heeft een succesvol debuut beleefd bij zijn nieuwe werkgever Heart of Midlothian . Met een assist was de van RKC Waalwijk overgekomen rechtsback direct belangrijk voor de zege van de stuntploeg, wat hem veel lof opleverde in de media.

items.title: Bournemouth v Arsenal: Premier League ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Premier League updates from the 5.30pm GMT kick-off ‚öΩ Live scores | Tables | Follow us on Bluesky | Email Barry Elsewhere in the Premier League: Wolves have finally won their first match of the season, scoring three without reply against sorry West Ham at Molineux. In news to make those of us who remember his Leeds United debut as a 16-year-old feel truly ancient, James Milner celebrated his 40th birthday by helping Brighton to a 2-0 win over Burnley, while Aston Villa got back to winning ways by beating Nottingham Forest 3-1 at Villa Park in today‚Äôs early kick-off. Wolves remain 12 points adrift of safety at the bottom of the table but today‚Äôs results mean life is looking a lot less bleak for Rob Edwards‚Äô side now than it did first thing this morning. View the Premier League table Continue reading...

items.title: Mali v Tunisia: Africa Cup of Nations last 16 ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Afcon updates from the 7pm GMT kick-off in Casablanca ‚öΩ Live scores | Follow us over on Bluesky | Email Dominic Let‚Äôs dive a bit deeper into those teams. The big news from a Malian perspective is the absence of key midfielder Amadou Haidara, who is suspended after being sent off late in their goalless draw with Comoros for a dangerous tackle. Aliou Dieng comes in to partner Yves Bissouma in the engine room. Continue reading...

items.title: Senegal be√´indigt Afrika Cup-droom Soedan in achtste finale
items.summary: Senegal heeft ten koste van Soedan de kwartfinale van het toernooi om de Afrika Cup bereikt. Villarreal-speler Pape Gueye groeide in de eerste achtste finale uit tot de uitblinker.

items.title: Nuno apologises to fans for 'very bad' performance
items.summary: West Ham United head coach Nuno Espirito Santo apologises to fans for the "worst performance" the Hammers have had and says the club "need to realise the situation" they are in, after losing 3-0 to bottom-of-the-table Wolverhampton Wanderers.

items.title: Prem Rugby: Bath snatch last-gasp win after Exeter's 26-point fightback
items.summary: Bath lost a 26-point lead in an epic south-west derby only to snatch back victory in the most dramatic fashion in the closing seconds to beat Exeter 33-26 and move back to the top of the Prem Rugby table.

items.title: Wolves thrash sorry West Ham to claim first Premier League win of the season
items.summary: This was the latest West Ham humiliation of the season, and possibly Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo‚Äôs last. They became the first team to lose to Wolves at the 20th time of asking, allowing the Midlands club to double their points tally in the process and bring hope of not being the worst team in Premier League history, while leaving the Hammers four points adrift of safety. Former Wolves head coach Nuno has already been sacked once this season and a ninth game without victory will increase the pressure on a man who was more popular with the home fans, who celebrated first-half goals from Jhon Arias, Hwang Hee-chan and Mateus Man√©, than the away end at Molineux. West Ham failed to get a shot on target against a team without a clean sheet prior to Saturday, who had secured three draws and nothing else in 19 matches, to put them in danger of falling below Derby‚Äôs record low of 11 points, although if the Hammers continue to play like this they might only finish three better off. Continue reading...
